intro: Schizoglossum aschersonianum var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed Schizoglossum, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. This variant is notable for its elongated inflorescences, which distinguish it from other varieties within the species.
